reviews.text: Nukkad Guest House is an OK place to stay at in Udaipur with clean rooms and good location but I didn't really enjoy staying there because of the hosts. I had the impression theye were doing so well with their hotel they didn't really have to care that much about just another customers. And they have a lot of rules to follow like no coming back after 11pm or no washing in the room (they do laundry at the hotel but of course you have to pay for it)
reviews.title: OK but nothing more

reviews.text: Rooms are celan, hists are very friendly. Raju book for us train tickets with no extra charge.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean family-run guesthouse
nice place to stay
reviews.text: We spent 2 days in this special place during the March month.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These helpful peoples are very nice, good services, excellent food, nice rooms design, good position, excellent roof terrace with good landscape and atmosphere, very good report price-quality, yoga and cooking courses, beautiful parks, a nice town.
reviews.title: A very nice place to stay in Udaipur!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this place.
reviews.title: Great family-run guesthouse!

reviews.text: Nukkad Guest house is in a good location, it's clean and we were able to check in a 5am after a night bus so we went to bed for a few hours. This was quite handy as we were worried we'd have to hang around until a decent hour to check in.  The guest house had also sent us a rickshaw (100Rs) so we didn't have to worry about tracking one down.
reviews.title: Good Choice in Udaipur

reviews.text: There is free Internet on the rooftop but they switch it off at 10pm.
reviews.title: Beautiful and well runned guesthouse.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Menu is ok for breakfast and lunch but there are plenty other places around to go for a nice meal.
reviews.title: Free yoga on the rooftop is a added bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, clean and big rooms. Kala and Raju Make really good food (but not always available- some hours the restaurant is closed). The restaurant has a really nice view and vibe.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Raju really helps with what ever needed.
reviews.title: Left the next morning!

reviews.text: The place is in order, they take a good care of it! The rooftop have a nice view of the lake and you can have home-made meals, take yoga lessons in the morning or just relax in the sofas refreshed by the wind. The family is very nice and friendly. My room was big and comfortable, with nice furniture and decorations (like all the building). The location is good and there is wifi.
reviews.title: Like at home!

reviews.text: This has to be my favourite place to stay in all of India. As a female travelling on my own a trustworthy guest house is a must and Raju definitely provides this! Even during the busiest time of Holi, as he was trying to run a very busy guest house and look after his family, he still managed to always have a smile on his face and make sure I had everything I needed. My room was clean, comfortable, very reasonably priced and the restaurant food is delicious. I can't recommend this hostel highly enough. Thanks Raju for making my stay in Udaipur so incredible, I will be back!
reviews.title: was meant to stay 2 nights stayed 10-AMAZING!

reviews.text: This is a really wonderful guest house, with comfortable clean rooms in a traditional building with a very attractive interior. What really makes it, though, is Raju and his family who made us very welcome and helped out with several arrangements. The food in the rooftop restaurant is awesome too.
reviews.title: Brilliant place - Raju is a star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a few nights during the Holi celebrations and es expected it was a very busy time in Udaipur and Nukkad Guest House. Despite the chaos, Raju the manager personally attended to our every need. Our room was very comfortable, we saw it was meticulously cleaned before we checked in. The friendly staff handled our meals perfectly during peak time at dinner and when my partner misplaced a significant amount of cash it was returned (in full) by the cleaner and Raju. We really appreciated their honesty as we weren't expecting to find it again! We really felt like part of the family and we recommend staying at Nukkad to everyone.
reviews.title: Great vibe and excellent, honest hospitality

reviews.text: We arrived in the middle of the night and were greeted by a welcoming smile from Raju even though we hadn't booked in advance. The bedroom was spacious, clean, shower and toilet worked perfectly and the building is just amazing. We enjoyed coffee for breakfast and a stunning view across the lake! The hostel is situated close to all attractions in Udaipur and Raju is extremely helpful organising excursions, bus tickets and transport. Absolutely briliant service! We also did a cooking class with his wife Kala and is was an amazing experience, sitting in her kitchen, learning her secrets of making the perfect spice paste and it was amongst the best foods I have tasted during my three months in India! She is a great cook, has a sprakling sense of humour and we learned a lot! Again Raju and Kala, many thanks for making us feel so welcome!
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed for three nights in this really nice hostel. Had a small one bed, one person room, but it had everything! Enough shelves, so it didn't feel as a cell at all! Also a small sitting place in front of my window. Which a loved a lot. The rooftop is really nice, staff is very kind and close to everything in Udaipur. Absolutely a nice hostel and very, very cheap and very, very clean!
reviews.title: Very nice hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Nukkad Guest House for 3 nights at 1000rs per night (The have other rooms starting from 400rs). We were quite luckily as we didn't make a reservation and managed to get a room at mid-day. The location is great, just 5 mins walk from the city palace and very close to the footbirdge.The room we stayed is called "Rainbow room", which is a very nice, clean and spacious room, with a window cushion seat and a lot of coloured windows. The room is located at the roof top, just next to the restaurant. The shower and toilet is separed and a bit small (compare to the room size). The toilet is a squat one but Raju (the manager) said they will replace it by a western type later. The shower came from the solar heater is VERY HOT (we didn't manage to adjust it to a suitale temperature even the cold tap is on, but Raju said he will check it....), but hot shower is only avaiable during day time till 6pm. The manager Raju is very nice, and you can see a lot of pictures of his family (including his great grand father!) in the house. The place is quite popular amongst backpackers so if you want to stay here better book ahead
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Udaipur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay in Udaipur at Nukkad Guest house. The rooms are clean and spacious, great food at the restaurant, and Raju (the owner) was incredibly welcoming and helpful our entire stay. Definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great stay, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located, it's in a nice traditional building haveli, with terrace roof restaurant. Hot water all the day! Room nice and clean with very clean bathroom. The owner and his family are really kind and helpful. Good choice.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, charming and good value
One man army
reviews.text: Elena & Andrea
